reviews.text: Well maintained lighthouse and good view of the port and South China Sea. You need to hike up the hill to reach the lighthouse. But once you reached the top, you will be rewarded by nice view of Kaohsiung city and port.
A short, but steep hike up to a beautiful viewing  spot and the lighthouse. The scenery around is just lovely.

About hundred steps up the hill, a light house emerge from the lush hill trees. Entering into the light house area you will have a panoramic view of Kaohsiung Harbour. A easy work out for young and old. I will recommend this as a must visit scenery in Kaohsiung.

I liked the fort and the light house a lot, you have an amazing view out to the beach and ocean and of course over the whole city of kaohsiung. Many good photo locations. You can spend a lot of time here even if you just sit and relax, watch the big boats coming and going... Or enjoy the sunset...
Nice place to go for a morning trail hike with the family. The hike is very easy with some stairs. The view is quite nice, and afterwards, you could go to the old street to grab lunch or snacks.

Good place for weekend. Specially when you have family along. Also for tourist, connected by tram (light) rail station. Playing area for kids, kite flying. Exhibits old fashioned train engines. Also accessible are nearby places like shipping port museum.
Kaohsiung first train station during Japanese colonize this country. A lot of empty space I think this place is only good for physical activities like walking and jogging.

The museum descends from the Kaohsiung Harbor Train Station, built during the Japanese period. The station was then the first railway station in Kaohsiung with the original name of Takow Station (Japanese: 打狗停車場). In 2003, the station building was classified as historical building by the Kaohsiung City Government. On 9 November 2008, the last train was pulled out from the station at 5.30 p.m.

Once the station was closed, the government took over the station building and land on the southern part of the station. On 24 October 2010, the government authorized the Railway Culture Society to enter the station for the opening of the Takao Railway Museum.
Located at C14 Hamasen station of the Light rail or  Siziwan station by Kaohsiung MRT orange line. Note that the Museum will be closed for 5 months from Jan. 1, 2019.
This musuem is big and fills with great show elements

Quite a nice open-area place with a lot of different art pieces shown about. There's even a little mini train ride that adults and children can ride on. 

Near the Pier2 Art Center is a large food court and ferry and there's a large open area where kids can run around and just be kids outside.

We even had the opportunity to see Spider-man vacationing in the area.

This is a great tourist stop for anyone in Kaohsiung.  It's along the light rail and the whole venue using of unexpected. Lots of outdoor areas nearby. Kite flying, market stalls, and finally of this art and master craft work. I couldn't help buying S few small things...
Lovely place for a stroll and view sunset. The nolstagia of the place was the most attractive part to me. There are also plenty of local cafes there but I didn't get to try them.

Worth visited! Just make sure to get there before 6 PM (closing time) and bring your camera to capture the unique view there.

There will be quite many mosquitoes around 6 PM there as well, if you bring kids, make sure to protect them well.
Awesome harbour district. Loads of places for nice pictures, a bit of shopping and food/coffee. Very original feeling, enjoyed it a lot.
This a a cool 10-20min stop. I did not ride the station but my family and I enjoyed the cool colorful pics we took. Worth a stop if you like a cool photo opportunity. It’s also free.

Take your time to have some photos here whenever you travel to Kaohsiung, Formosa Boulevard Station is cool with the patterned ceiling.

Moreover, we were lucky cause we can see their lighting show during Christmas time.

The station is a three-level, underground station with an island platform and two side platforms. It is located at the junction of Jhongjheng and Jhongshan Road and has 11 exits. The Orange Line station is 334 metres long, while the Red Line station is 209 metres long.

The station is known for its "Dome of Light", the largest glass work in the world. It was designed by Italian artist Narcissus Quagliata. It is 30 metres in diameter and covers an area of 2,180 square metres. It is made up of 4,500 glass panels. The dome will be offered as venues for weddings.
Main station in Kaosiung. Looks much prettier in photo than actual.

It’s apparently one of the most instagrammable spot in Kaohsiung, and I’ll have to agree with that!

The station’s arch deco looks pretty amazing - but only thru photos. I’d have to say the colours aren’t as vibrant in real life compared to the photos.

Nevertheless, it’s a great place to take photos.

This mountain is one of the great mountains in Taiwan. A magnificent spectacle spread itself out before the eyes. I drank in the beauty of the landscape. U may say that what a fantastic mountain scene! 
Macaca cyclopis is a endemic species in Taiwan in Shoushan(this mountain). They like to attack people that carry some food to eat in this mountain. So u must take care your food and your children.
I enjoy the monkey
Nice viewing

壽山，古稱打狗山、打鼓山、鼓山，俗稱柴山
是一座位於台灣高雄市西南濱海的山
也是高雄市臨海的天然屏障
其地質屬隆起珊瑚礁石灰岩，天然岩洞甚多
循著曲折狹小的石灰岩洞穴前進
可見石筍、石柱等鐘乳石結晶
見證大自然造物的神奇與奧妙。
同時壽山也被稱為高雄市的都市之肺
是高雄第一高山

壽山內最為人津津樂道的
便是有非常多野生猴子
上山千萬不要大辣辣地吃東西
以免猴子群來搶

山上有壽山公園、忠烈祠、動物園等觀光景點
而忠烈祠、壽山公園，可遠眺高雄市的夜景
景色很美，沿著木棧道走適合健行，木棧道旁的小路適合探險，上山前記得帶水，還有考慮體力的負荷，以免困在山上

餐點很普通 女僕來聊天 搞得我尷尬癌發作 我想安靜吃飯
現在的湯裡好像越來越貴了我就沒去了還要加一成服務費
生意很好的樣子，我過去十年來在所有月讀系列餐廳中只有一次聖誕節跟一次新年在進去前被請走，加這次平常日就三次了。不建議隨意造訪。
女僕很健談，餐點口味很恰當
今天唱歌的女僕很可愛！
